verses.kjv: Yet now hear, O Jacob my servant; and Israel, whom I have chosen:
verses.web: Yet listen now, Jacob my servant, and Israel, whom I have chosen.
verses.ct: "But now listen, Jacob my servant — Israel, the one I have chosen.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD that made thee, and formed thee from the womb, which will help thee; Fear not, O Jacob, my servant; and thou, Jesurun, whom I have chosen.
verses.web: This is what LORD who made you, and formed you from the womb, who will help you says: “Don’t be afraid, Jacob my servant; and you, Jeshurun, whom I have chosen.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says — the one who made you, who shaped you in the womb, and who will help you: "Don't be afraid, Jacob my servant, and you, Jeshurun, whom I have chosen.

verses.kjv: For I will pour water upon him that is thirsty, and floods upon the dry ground: I will pour my spirit upon thy seed, and my blessing upon thine offspring:
verses.web: For I will pour water on him who is thirsty, and streams on the dry ground. I will pour my Spirit on your descendants, and my blessing on your offspring:
verses.ct: I will pour water on the thirsty and send streams across the dry ground. I will pour my Spirit on your descendants and my blessing on your offspring.

verses.kjv: And they shall spring up as among the grass, as willows by the water courses.
verses.web: and they will spring up among the grass, as willows by the watercourses.
verses.ct: They will spring up like grass in a meadow, like willows growing beside flowing streams.

verses.kjv: One shall say, I am the LORD’s; and another shall call himself by the name of Jacob; and another shall subscribe with his hand unto the LORD, and surname himself by the name of Israel.
verses.web: One will say, ‘I am LORD’s;’ and another will be called by the name of Jacob; and another will write with his hand ‘to LORD,’ and honor the name of Israel.”
verses.ct: One person will say, 'I belong to the LORD.' Another will take the name of Jacob. Still another will write on his hand, 'The LORD's,' and proudly take the name of Israel."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD the King of Israel, and his redeemer the LORD of hosts; I am the first, and I am the last; and beside me there is no God.
verses.web: This is what LORD, the King of Israel, and his Redeemer, LORD of Armies, says: “I am the first, and I am the last; and besides me there is no God.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says — the King of Israel and his Redeemer, the LORD of Armies: "I am the first, and I am the last. There is no God besides me.

verses.kjv: And who, as I, shall call, and shall declare it, and set it in order for me, since I appointed the ancient people? and the things that are coming, and shall come, let them shew unto them.
verses.web: Who is like me? Who will call, and will declare it, and set it in order for me, since I established the ancient people? Let them declare the things that are coming, and that will happen.
verses.ct: Who is like me? Let him step forward and declare it — let him lay it out in order before me. Ever since I established my ancient people, who has announced what is coming and what will happen? Let them prove it.

verses.kjv: Fear ye not, neither be afraid: have not I told thee from that time, and have declared it? ye are even my witnesses. Is there a God beside me? yea, there is no God; I know not any.
verses.web: Don’t fear, neither be afraid. Haven’t I declared it to you long ago, and shown it? You are my witnesses. Is there a God besides me? Indeed, there is not. I don’t know any other Rock.”
verses.ct: Don't be afraid. Don't tremble. Haven't I told you long ago and declared it? You are my witnesses! Is there any God besides me? There is no other Rock — I know of none."

verses.kjv: They that make a graven image are all of them vanity; and their delectable things shall not profit; and they are their own witnesses; they see not, nor know; that they may be ashamed.
verses.web: Everyone who makes a carved image is vain. The things that they delight in will not profit. Their own witnesses don’t see, nor know, that they may be disappointed.
verses.ct: Everyone who makes an idol is chasing emptiness. The things they treasure are worthless. Their own followers are witnesses against them — they can't see and they don't understand. They're headed for shame.

verses.kjv: Who hath formed a god, or molten a graven image that is profitable for nothing?
verses.web: Who has fashioned a god, or molds an image that is profitable for nothing?
verses.ct: Who would fashion a god or cast an idol that can do absolutely nothing for them?

verses.kjv: Behold, all his fellows shall be ashamed: and the workmen, they are of men: let them all be gathered together, let them stand up; yet they shall fear, and they shall be ashamed together.
verses.web: Behold, all his fellows will be disappointed; and the workmen are mere men. Let them all be gathered together. Let them stand up. They will fear. They will be put to shame together.
verses.ct: Look — everyone involved with that idol will be put to shame. The craftsmen are only human. Let them all gather together and take their stand. They will tremble, and together they will be humiliated.

verses.kjv: The smith with the tongs both worketh in the coals, and fashioneth it with hammers, and worketh it with the strength of his arms: yea, he is hungry, and his strength faileth: he drinketh no water, and is faint.
verses.web: The blacksmith takes an ax, works in the coals, fashions it with hammers, and works it with his strong arm. He is hungry, and his strength fails; he drinks no water, and is faint.
verses.ct: The blacksmith works at his forge, hammering and shaping the metal with his strong arms. He gets hungry and loses his strength. He doesn't stop to drink water, and he grows faint.

verses.kjv: The carpenter stretcheth out his rule; he marketh it out with a line; he fitteth it with planes, and he marketh it out with the compass, and maketh it after the figure of a man, according to the beauty of a man; that it may remain in the house.
verses.web: The carpenter stretches out a line. He marks it out with a pencil. He shapes it with planes. He marks it out with compasses, and shapes it like the figure of a man, with the beauty of a man, to reside in a house.
verses.ct: The woodworker stretches out a measuring line and marks the outline with a pencil. He shapes it with chisels and traces it with a compass, carving it into the figure of a man — a beautiful human form — so it can sit in a house.

verses.kjv: He heweth him down cedars, and taketh the cypress and the oak, which he strengtheneth for himself among the trees of the forest: he planteth an ash, and the rain doth nourish it.
verses.web: He cuts down cedars for himself, and takes the cypress and the oak, and strengthens for himself one among the trees of the forest. He plants a cypress tree, and the rain nourishes it.
verses.ct: He cuts down cedars for himself, or picks out a cypress or an oak from the forest and lets it grow strong among the other trees. He plants a tree, and the rain makes it grow.

verses.kjv: Then shall it be for a man to burn: for he will take thereof, and warm himself; yea, he kindleth it, and baketh bread; yea, he maketh a god, and worshippeth it; he maketh it a graven image, and falleth down thereto.
verses.web: Then it will be for a man to burn; and he takes some of it, and warms himself. Yes, he burns it, and bakes bread. Yes, he makes a god, and worships it; he makes it a carved image, and falls down to it.
verses.ct: Then he uses that same wood for fuel. He takes some of it and warms himself by the fire. He kindles a flame and bakes bread. And with what's left? He makes a god and worships it! He carves an idol and bows down before it.

verses.kjv: He burneth part thereof in the fire; with part thereof he eateth flesh; he roasteth roast, and is satisfied: yea, he warmeth himself, and saith, Aha, I am warm, I have seen the fire:
verses.web: He burns part of it in the fire. With part of it, he eats meat. He roasts a roast, and is satisfied. Yes, he warms himself, and says, “Aha! I am warm. I have seen the fire.”
verses.ct: He burns half the wood in the fire. Over that half he cooks his meat, roasts his dinner, and eats until he's full. He warms himself and says, "Ah, that feels good! I can feel the heat of the fire."

verses.kjv: And the residue thereof he maketh a god, even his graven image: he falleth down unto it, and worshippeth it, and prayeth unto it, and saith, Deliver me; for thou art my god.
verses.web: The rest of it he makes into a god, even his engraved image. He bows down to it and worships, and prays to it, and says, “Deliver me; for you are my god!”
verses.ct: Then from the leftover wood he makes a god — his carved idol. He bows down to it and worships it. He prays to it and says, "Save me! You are my god!"

verses.kjv: They have not known nor understood: for he hath shut their eyes, that they cannot see; and their hearts, that they cannot understand.
verses.web: They don’t know, neither do they consider: for he has shut their eyes, that they can’t see; and their hearts, that they can’t understand.
verses.ct: These people don't know and don't understand. Their eyes have been shut so they can't see, and their hearts have been closed so they can't think clearly.

verses.kjv: And none considereth in his heart, neither is there knowledge nor understanding to say, I have burned part of it in the fire; yea, also I have baked bread upon the coals thereof; I have roasted flesh, and eaten it: and shall I make the residue thereof an abomination? shall I fall down to the stock of a tree?
verses.web: No one thinks, neither is there knowledge nor understanding to say, “I have burned part of it in the fire. Yes, I have also baked bread on its coals. I have roasted meat and eaten it. Shall I make the rest of it into an abomination? Shall I bow down to a tree trunk?”
verses.ct: Not one of them stops to think it through. No one has the sense to say, "I burned half of this wood in the fire. I baked bread over the coals and roasted meat and ate it. Should I really make the rest of it into something disgusting? Should I bow down to a block of wood?"

verses.kjv: He feedeth on ashes: a deceived heart hath turned him aside, that he cannot deliver his soul, nor say, Is there not a lie in my right hand?
verses.web: He feeds on ashes. A deceived heart has turned him aside; and he can’t deliver his soul, nor say, “Isn’t there a lie in my right hand?”
verses.ct: He's feeding on ashes. A deceived heart has led him astray, and he can't rescue his own soul. He can't even ask himself, "Isn't this thing in my hand a lie?"

verses.kjv: Remember these, O Jacob and Israel; for thou art my servant: I have formed thee; thou art my servant: O Israel, thou shalt not be forgotten of me.
verses.web: Remember these things, Jacob and Israel; for you are my servant. I have formed you. You are my servant. Israel, you will not be forgotten by me.
verses.ct: "Remember these things, Jacob and Israel, because you are my servant. I formed you. You are my servant. Israel, I will not forget you.

verses.kjv: I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, thy transgressions, and, as a cloud, thy sins: return unto me; for I have redeemed thee.
verses.web: I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, your transgressions, and, as a cloud, your sins. Return to me, for I have redeemed you.
verses.ct: I have swept away your sins like a thick cloud and your transgressions like morning mist. Come back to me, because I have redeemed you."

verses.kjv: Sing, O ye heavens; for the LORD hath done it: shout, ye lower parts of the earth: break forth into singing, ye mountains, O forest, and every tree therein: for the LORD hath redeemed Jacob, and glorified himself in Israel.
verses.web: Sing, you heavens, for LORD has done it! Shout, you lower parts of the earth! Break out into singing, you mountains, O forest, all of your trees, for LORD has redeemed Jacob, and will glorify himself in Israel.
verses.ct: Sing for joy, you heavens, because the LORD has done it! Shout, you depths of the earth! Break out in song, you mountains, you forests and every tree! The LORD has redeemed Jacob and displayed his glory in Israel.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, thy redeemer, and he that formed thee from the womb, I am the LORD that maketh all things; that stretcheth forth the heavens alone; that spreadeth abroad the earth by myself;
verses.web: LORD, your Redeemer, and he who formed you from the womb says: “I am LORD, who makes all things; who alone stretches out the heavens; who spreads out the earth by myself;
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says — your Redeemer, who formed you in the womb: "I am the LORD, the maker of all things. I stretched out the heavens by myself. I spread out the earth alone.

verses.kjv: That frustrateth the tokens of the liars, and maketh diviners mad; that turneth wise men backward, and maketh their knowledge foolish;
verses.web: who frustrates the signs of the liars, and makes diviners mad; who turns wise men backward, and makes their knowledge foolish;
verses.ct: I expose the signs of false prophets as lies and make fools of fortune-tellers. I turn the wisdom of the wise upside down and make their knowledge look foolish.

verses.kjv: That confirmeth the word of his servant, and performeth the counsel of his messengers; that saith to Jerusalem, Thou shalt be inhabited; and to the cities of Judah, Ye shall be built, and I will raise up the decayed places thereof:
verses.web: who confirms the word of his servant, and performs the counsel of his messengers; who says of Jerusalem, ‘She will be inhabited;’ and of the cities of Judah, ‘They will be built,’ and ‘I will raise up its waste places;’
verses.ct: But I confirm the word of my servant and carry out the plans announced by my messengers. I say of Jerusalem, 'She will be inhabited again,' and of the cities of Judah, 'They will be rebuilt — I will restore their ruins.'

verses.kjv: That saith to the deep, Be dry, and I will dry up thy rivers:
verses.web: who says to the deep, ‘Be dry,’ and ‘I will dry up your rivers;’
verses.ct: I say to the deep waters, 'Be dry!' and 'I will dry up your rivers.'

verses.kjv: That saith of Cyrus, He is my shepherd, and shall perform all my pleasure: even saying to Jerusalem, Thou shalt be built; and to the temple, Thy foundation shall be laid.
verses.web: Who says of Cyrus, ‘He is my shepherd, and shall perform all my pleasure,’ even saying of Jerusalem, ‘She will be built;’ and of the temple, ‘Your foundation will be laid.’ ”
verses.ct: I say of Cyrus, 'He is my shepherd, and he will carry out everything I desire.' He will say of Jerusalem, 'She will be rebuilt,' and of the temple, 'Your foundation will be laid again.'"
